questions.question: Wat is die naam van die hospitaal of kliniek en waar is dit geleë?
Wat is die kommentaar van amptenare wat verantwoordelik is vir die lewering van die diens?
Het pasiënte al voorheen die fasilteit besoek?
questions.description: Indien ja, was hul lêer beskikbaar toe hulle behandel is?

questions.question: Hoe ver moes pasiënte wat jy ondervra het, reis om daar te kom?
Hoe het hulle daar gekom?
questions.description: (per bus, taxi, trein, of te voet)

questions.question: Wat was hul retoerkoste?
Watter dienste word nie gelewer nie, al is hulle nodig?
Hoekom word hierdie dienste nie meer gelewer nie?
Wie word daardeur geraak?
questions.description: (`n Spesifieke groep mense/gebied uit watter sosio-ekonomiese agtergrond kom hulle)

questions.question: Hoeveel mense word geraak, of word in gevaar gestel as gevolg van die onttrekking van hierdie dienste?
Wat is die name en ouderdomme van diegene wat geraak word en wat is hul ervarings?
Hoe lank wag pasiënte voor`n dokter of gesondheidswerker hulle kan sien?
Is daar genoeg - en die regte - medikasie beskikbaar?
Wie is verantwoordelik vir die dienslewering?
Additional info/notes
Contact details of people you've interviewed
What is the name of the hospital or clinic and where is it situated?
What is the response from officials responsible for delivering the service?
Have patients visited the facility previously? If yes, was their file available when they were treated?
What distance did patients you interviewed have to travel to get there?
How did they get there?
What was the cost of their return fare?
What services are not being offered when they should be?
Why are these services no longer being offered?
Who is affected by this?
questions.description: (A particular group of people / area and what are their socio-economic backgrounds?

questions.question: How many people are affected, at risk or in danger because of the withdrawal of these services?
What are the names and ages of those affected and what are their experiences?
How long do patients wait to be seen by doctors/health workers?
Is there sufficient - and the correct - medication available?
Who is responsible for delivering the services?
Additional info/notes
Contact details of people you've interviewed
